intro: Asteromoea koraiensis, commonly known as the Korean asteromoea, is a flowering plant native to the Korean Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in forested areas and mountainous regions, preferring moist, well-drained soils. It produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
